comments:
Driver: RC1

WSDL editor does not show Apache Axis generate WSDL files correctly. Basically, 
there's nothing shown in the WSDL editor (I just see the 
Imports/Types/Services/... boxes). Nothing in .log. The WSDL editor shows the 
WSDL wizard generated WSDL files correctly. Perhaps this is a rpc/encoded vs. a 
doc/lit thing? Here's the Apache Axis generated WSDL file:

<wsdl:definitions targetNamespace="http://test" xmlns:impl="http://test" 
xmlns:intf="http://test" xmlns:apachesoap="http://xml.apache.org/xml-soap" 
xmlns:wsdlsoap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/soap/" 
xmlns:soapenc="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" 
xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" 
xmlns:wsdl="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/" 
xmlns="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/wsdl/">

   <wsdl:message name="heloRequest">

      <wsdl:part name="s" type="xsd:string"/>

   </wsdl:message>

   <wsdl:message name="heloResponse">

      <wsdl:part name="heloReturn" type="xsd:string"/>

   </wsdl:message>

   <wsdl:portType name="MyService">

      <wsdl:operation name="helo" parameterOrder="s">

         <wsdl:input name="heloRequest" message="impl:heloRequest"/>

         <wsdl:output name="heloResponse" message="impl:heloResponse"/>

      </wsdl:operation>

   </wsdl:portType>

   <wsdl:binding name="MyServiceSoapBinding" type="impl:MyService">

      <wsdlsoap:binding style="rpc" 
transport="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/http"/>

      <wsdl:operation name="helo">

         <wsdlsoap:operation soapAction=""/>

         <wsdl:input name="heloRequest">

            <wsdlsoap:body use="encoded" 
encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" 
namespace="http://test"/>

         </wsdl:input>

         <wsdl:output name="heloResponse">

            <wsdlsoap:body use="encoded" 
encodingStyle="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/encoding/" 
namespace="http://test"/>

         </wsdl:output>

      </wsdl:operation>

   </wsdl:binding>

   <wsdl:service name="MyServiceService">

      <wsdl:port name="MyService" binding="impl:MyServiceSoapBinding">

         <wsdlsoap:address 
location="http://localhost:8080/wp/services/MyService"/>

      </wsdl:port>

   </wsdl:service>

</wsdl:definitions>

Actually, there's a trace in the console:

Created an attachment (id=24955)
Not loading a WSDL without a Definiton name attribute.

simple patch to ensure we finish loading a WSDL file without a Definition name
attribute.

Created an attachment (id=44590)
Patch for the missing definition name

The previous patch makes it possible to open WSDL files missing the name definition without throwing an exception, however, the name element would be null instead of the empty string. This is solved in the attached patch.

traces.message: local part cannot be "null" when creating a QName
